text:
Something like this is what I'd suggest.

1. Make `Modules, Sections, Layouts` into tabs
2. Add the categories as filters, this makes its more of an 'optional' steps. 
3. This also cuts the width of the sidebar flyout by 50%
<@U05GP3MBP9D> feedback request for the DnD editor and modules categories/search

this is all great! thank you :slightly_smiling_face: keep it coming! One thing I am interested in as well is - how do you feel about the modules themselves? Do we need a way to differentiate between Theme/Standalone/HubSPot modules?

Particularly, I much like the Editor of the Canva Sidepan.
• They grouped all child objects of the category in horizontal scrolling with arrows in limited space. We can use that for categories. 
• The tab suggestion is a great idea from <@UATE4ATHP> for the main building blocks
• To differentiate modules, we can give a quick sort/dropdown icon in the search bar itself having values Default HS Modules, Theme Modules, and Standalone modules which shows the items based on the selection on the pane.
